intro: Scolopia manongarivae, commonly known as the Manongariva scolopia, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
